bug.author: flynneva
bug.summary: ubuntu 20.04 python3.8 unable to run streamlit hello
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
After following the install instructions and installing streamlit via pip3 install streamlit i get the following error while trying to run streamlit hello: <denchmark-code>$ streamlit hello Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/flynn/.local/bin/streamlit", line 5, in <module> from streamlit.cli import main File "/home/flynn/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/streamlit/__init__.py", line 75, in <module> from streamlit.delta_generator import DeltaGenerator as _DeltaGenerator File "/home/flynn/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/streamlit/delta_generator.py", line 25, in <module> from streamlit.proto import Block_pb2 File "/home/flynn/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/streamlit/proto/Block_pb2.py", line 21, in <module> create_key=_descriptor._internal_create_key, AttributeError: module 'google.protobuf.descriptor' has no attribute '_internal_create_key' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
ubuntu 20.04 python 3.8.5 pip3 install streamlit streamlit hello
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
streamlit hello should run demo app <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
streamlit hello results in error output <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
not sure, this is my first time trying to use streamlit <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: running streamlit version results in same error as above Python version: Python 3.8.5 Using Conda? no PipEnv? no PyEnv? no Pex? no OS version: Ubuntu 20.04 Browser version: Chromium 85.0.4183.121 snap

comments.comment: streamlit version that pip3 installed was streamlit-0.69.1

turns out the protobuf version was old. running pip3 install --upgrade protobuf fixed my error. <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/61922334/how-to-solve-attributeerror-module-google-protobuf-descriptor-has-no-attribu>link to stackoverflow answer</denchmark-link> that helped me
